page.title: 20TRANSPORT IN CORBRIDGE
page.content: Most people in Corbridge travel by road and since the road system in Corbridge itself is based on the historical pattern it leads to some delays and difficulties over parking particularly during the summer tourist season.Two major roads which used to pass through the village now by-pass it.They are the A68,the main north- south route and the A69,the main east- west route.Corbridge has a good twice hourly bus service which links Corbridge with Newcastle,Hexham and Carlisle.These towns can also be reached by an hourly train service, with a new diesel Pacer train being introduced to the Tyne Valley in October 1985.A local twice weekly bus service connects Corbridge and surrounding villages with Hexham on market days.
